----------------------------
Features:
----------------------------
- Multiplatform program (Windows, Linux, Mac)
- Getting Local Quake Info from BMKG
- Play the audio when detected a big magnitude
- System Tray Icon (If your OS isn't support, will be moved to the Main Window)
- Getting earthquake information automatically for some interval(s) (user defined, you can also get the earthquake info manually)
- Information Bar (if you forgot when the new earthquake is occured)

----------------------------
Minimum System Requirements
----------------------------
Processor: Intel Pentium 4 1.0 GHz or greater
RAM: 256 MB
HDD: 5 MB
Resolution: 800 x 600

Additional:
- Internet Connection
- JRE/JDK 7 or newer

----------------------------
How To
----------------------------
1. Launch the program
	- You can double-click the JGetQuakeInfo.jar
	- Use CMD/Terminal:
		java -jar "JGetQuakeInfo.jar"

2. Getting new information
	- When your OS is support the System Tray:
		Right click JGetQuakeInfo tray icon > Gempa > Cek informasi gempa terbaru...
	- When your OS isn't support the System Tray
		a. From Main Window:
			Click "PERBARUI INFO"
		b. From Information Bar:
			Right click > Gempa > Cek informasi gempa terbaru...
			
3. Get Last Information
	- When your OS is support the System Tray:
		Right click JGetQuakeInfo tray icon > Gempa > Lihat informasi terakhir
	- When your OS isn't support the System Tray
		a. From Main Window:
			Click "GEMPA TERAKHIR"
		b. From Information Bar:
			Right click > Gempa > Lihat informasi terakhir
			
4. Customizing the UI
	- When your OS is support the System Tray:
		a. Right click JGetQuakeInfo tray icon > Preferensi
		b. Select the "Umum" tab
		c. In "Desain UI", select what the UI's you want to apply to JGetQuakeInfo
		d. Click "Terapkan" then "OK"
		e. Restart the application
	- When your OS isn't support the System Tray
		a. From Main Window:
			a. Click "PREFERENSI"
			b. Select the "Umum" tab
			c. In "Desain UI", select what the UI's you want to apply to JGetQuakeInfo
			d. Click "Terapkan" then "OK"
			e. Restart the application
		b. From Information Bar:
			a. Right click > Preferensi
			b. Select the "Umum" tab
			c. In "Desain UI", select what the UI's you want to apply to JGetQuakeInfo
			d. Click "Terapkan" then "OK"
			e. Restart the application
			
----------------------------
Solutions
----------------------------
- When your JGetQuakeInfo's Preferences was error
	Open the "JGQIReset.jar" then follow the instructions on the window
- When you found an error
	Screenshot it, save the log file and send these files (screenshot(s) and log file) with explains when and how the error occured to me
